array.string: Hello and welcome aboard this flight bound for several exciting destinations today. I am Yew Dit, your captain.
Before we take off, make sure your objects are stowed away in a safe array that will not be released. Those using arc may want to keep an eye on their objects at all times.
Keep an eye on the lighted signs and donâ€™t ignore any warnings.
Ensure your LLDB session is firmly connected in case of any unexpected breakpoints.
If extra memory is deployed, please ensure you have adequate supply before helping any sub classes.
If an emergency should occur during take off or landing, adopt the recommended brace position.
Federal regulations prohibits auto release on any ARC operated flights.
Your crew are now pointing out Emergency Releases. Count the number of rows between you and your nearest release.
In the event that our pool is drained, defaults will be distributed to save your state.
So now in preparation for take off, please pause all dispatch queues, we'll let you know when it's safe to resume them. Smaller queues may be running at all times.
Thank you and enjoy your journey and feel free to connect to the in flight entertainment by connecting to an external display.
